words.def: the skilled practice of a practical occupation
a piece of information about circumstances that exist or events that have occurred
a flat float (usually made of logs or planks) that can be used for transport or as a platform for swimmers
a social club for male undergraduates
a reflex that expels intestinal gas through the anus
a heavy open wagon usually having two wheels and drawn by an animal
a terrorist organization that seeks to overthrow the government dominated by Tutsi and to institute Hutu control again
(nautical, aeronautical) situated at or toward the stern or tail
a soft greasy substance occurring in organic tissue and consisting of a mixture of lipids (mostly triglycerides)
feline mammal usually having thick soft fur and no ability to roar: domestic cats
a motor vehicle with four wheels
electrical conduction through a gas in an applied electric field
a legal document codifying the result of deliberations of a committee or society or legislative body
any of various long-tailed rodents similar to but larger than a mouse
any of various dark heavy viscid substances obtained as a residue
the products of human creativity
the syllable naming the fourth (subdominant) note of the diatonic scale in solmization
a highly unstable radioactive element (the heaviest of the halogen series)
a hard grey lustrous metallic element that is highly resistant to corrosion
a colorless and odorless inert gas
